multiple_choice.choice: The ratio of water and solutes in a solution.
When already diluted tubular fluid flows through the ascending limb of the nephron loop
Reabsorbed water in the collecting ducts.

response.feedback: Correct. Osmolarity of a solution is comprised of the number of solute particles dissolved in one kilogram of water.
Incorrect. The action of the ascending limb of the nephron loop is the production of dilute filtrate.
Incorrect. The collecting ducts can be stimulated to increase water reabsorption and can manipulate the osmolarity of the filtrate.
Incorrect. Urine entering the renal pelvis has reached its final osmolarity or concentration.
